com.metsci.glimpse.com.jogamp.opengl.util.awt

Class TextRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.metsci.glimpse.com.jogamp.opengl.util.awt.TextRenderer

  • public final class TextRenderer
extends Object
    Utility for rendering bitmapped Java 2D text into an OpenGL window.

    TextRenderer has high performance, full Unicode support, and a simple API. It performs appropriate caching of text rendering results in an OpenGL texture internally to avoid repeated font rasterization. The caching is completely automatic, does not require any user intervention, and has no visible controls in the public API.

    Using TextRenderer is simple. Add a TextRenderer field to your GLEventListener and in your init method, add: 

     renderer = new TextRenderer(new Font("SansSerif", Font.BOLD, 36));

    In the display method of your GLEventListener, add: 

     renderer.beginRendering(drawable.getWidth(), drawable.getHeight());
 // optionally set the color
 renderer.setColor(1.0f, 0.2f, 0.2f, 0.8f);
 renderer.draw("Text to draw", xPosition, yPosition);
 // ... more draw commands, color changes, etc.
 renderer.endRendering();

    Unless you are sharing textures between OpenGL contexts, you do not need to call the dispose method of the TextRenderer; the OpenGL resources it uses internally will be cleaned up automatically when the OpenGL context is destroyed.

    Note that a TextRenderer will cause the Vertex Array Object binding to change, or to be unbound.

    Internally, the renderer uses a rectangle packing algorithm to pack both glyphs and full strings' rendering results (which are variable size) onto a larger OpenGL texture. The internal backing store is maintained using a TextureRenderer. A least recently used (LRU) algorithm is used to discard previously rendered strings; the specific algorithm is undefined, but is currently implemented by flushing unused strings' rendering results every few hundred rendering cycles, where a rendering cycle is defined as a pair of calls to beginRendering / endRendering.

    Author:
    John Burkey, Kenneth Russell

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextRenderer

        public TextRenderer(Font font)
        Constructs a TextRenderer.

        The resulting TextRenderer will use no antialiasing or fractional metrics and the default render delegate. It will not attempt to use OpenGL's automatic mipmap generation for better scaling. All Unicode characters will be available.

        Parameters:
        font - Font to render text with
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if font is null

      • TextRenderer

        public TextRenderer(Font font,
                    boolean mipmap)
        Constructs a TextRenderer with optional mipmapping.

        The resulting TextRenderer will use no antialiasing or fractional metrics, and the default render delegate. If mipmapping is requested, the text renderer will attempt to use OpenGL's automatic mipmap generation for better scaling. All Unicode characters will be available.

        Parameters:
        font - Font to render text with
        mipmap - True to generate mipmaps (to make the text scale better)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if font is null

      • TextRenderer

        public TextRenderer(Font font,
                    boolean antialias,
                    boolean subpixel)
        Constructs a TextRenderer with optional text properties.

        The resulting TextRenderer will use antialiasing and fractional metrics if requested, and the default render delegate. It will not attempt to use OpenGL's automatic mipmap generation for better scaling. All Unicode characters will be available.

        Parameters:
        font - Font to render text with
        antialias - True to smooth edges of text
        subpixel - True to use subpixel accuracy
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if font is null

      • TextRenderer

        public TextRenderer(Font font,
                    boolean antialias,
                    boolean subpixel,
                    TextRenderer.RenderDelegate rd)
        Constructs a TextRenderer with optional text properties and a render delegate.

        The resulting TextRenderer will use antialiasing and fractional metrics if requested. The optional render delegate provides more control over the text rendered. The TextRenderer will not attempt to use OpenGL's automatic mipmap generation for better scaling. All Unicode characters will be available.

        Parameters:
        font - Font to render text with
        antialias - True to smooth edges of text
        subpixel - True to use subpixel accuracy
        rd - Optional controller of rendering details
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if font is null

      • TextRenderer

        public TextRenderer(Font font,
                    boolean antialias,
                    boolean subpixel,
                    TextRenderer.RenderDelegate rd,
                    boolean mipmap)
        Constructs a TextRenderer with optional text properties, a render delegate, and mipmapping.

        The resulting TextRenderer will use antialiasing and fractional metrics if requested. The optional render delegate provides more control over the text rendered. If mipmapping is requested, the TextRenderer will attempt to use OpenGL's automatic mipmap generation for better scaling. All Unicode characters will be available.

        Parameters:
        font - Font to render text with
        antialias - True to smooth edges of text
        subpixel - True to use subpixel accuracy
        rd - Optional controller of rendering details
        mipmap - Whether to generate mipmaps to make the text scale better
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if font is null

      • TextRenderer

        public TextRenderer(Font font,
                    boolean antialias,
                    boolean subpixel,
                    TextRenderer.RenderDelegate rd,
                    boolean mipmap,
                    Character.UnicodeBlock ub)
        Constructs a TextRenderer with optional text properties, a render delegate, mipmapping, and a range of characters.

        The resulting TextRenderer will use antialiasing and fractional metrics if requested. The optional render delegate provides more control over the text rendered. If mipmapping is requested, the text renderer will attempt to use OpenGL's automatic mipmap generation for better scaling. If a character range is specified, the text renderer will limit itself to those characters to try to achieve better performance. Otherwise all Unicode characters will be available.

        Parameters:
        font - Font to render text with
        antialias - True to smooth edges of text
        subpixel - True to use subpixel accuracy
        rd - Controller of rendering details, or null to use the default
        mipmap - Whether to generate mipmaps to make the text scale better
        ub - Range of unicode characters, or null to use the default
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if font is null

    • Method Detail

      • begin3DRendering

        public void begin3DRendering()
        Starts a 3D render cycle.

        Assumes the end user is responsible for setting up the modelview and projection matrices, and will render text using the draw3D(java.lang.CharSequence, float, float, float, float) method.

        Throws:
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current

      • beginRendering

        public void beginRendering(int width,
                           int height)
        Starts an orthographic render cycle.

        Sets up a two-dimensional orthographic projection with (0,0) as the lower-left coordinate and (width, height) as the upper-right coordinate. Binds and enables the internal OpenGL texture object, sets the texture environment mode to GL_MODULATE, and changes the current color to the last color set with this text drawer via setColor(java.awt.Color).

        This method disables the depth test and is equivalent to beginRendering(width, height, true).

        Parameters:
        width - Width of the current on-screen OpenGL drawable
        height - Height of the current on-screen OpenGL drawable
        Throws:
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current
        IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is negative

      • beginRendering

        public void beginRendering(int width,
                           int height,
                           boolean disableDepthTest)
        Starts an orthographic render cycle.

        Sets up a two-dimensional orthographic projection with (0,0) as the lower-left coordinate and (width, height) as the upper-right coordinate. Binds and enables the internal OpenGL texture object, sets the texture environment mode to GL_MODULATE, and changes the current color to the last color set with this text drawer via setColor(java.awt.Color).

        Disables the depth test if requested.

        Parameters:
        width - Width of the current on-screen OpenGL drawable
        height - Height of the current on-screen OpenGL drawable
        disableDepthTest - True to disable the depth test
        Throws:
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current
        IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is negative

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Destroys resources used by the text renderer.
        Throws:
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if no OpenGL context is current, or is unexpected version

      • getFontRenderContext

        public FontRenderContext getFontRenderContext()

      • draw

        public void draw(CharSequence text,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Draws a character sequence at a location.

        The baseline of the leftmost character is at position (x, y) specified in OpenGL coordinates, where the origin is at the lower-left of the drawable and the Y coordinate increases in the upward direction.

        Parameters:
        text - Text to draw
        x - Position to draw on X axis
        y - Position to draw on Y axis
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if text is null
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current, or is unexpected version

      • draw

        public void draw(String text,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Draws a string at a location.

        The baseline of the leftmost character is at position (x, y) specified in OpenGL coordinates, where the origin is at the lower-left of the drawable and the Y coordinate increases in the upward direction.

        Parameters:
        text - Text to draw
        x - Position to draw on X axis
        y - Position to draw on Y axis
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if text is null
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current, or is unexpected version

      • draw3D

        public void draw3D(CharSequence text,
                   float x,
                   float y,
                   float z,
                   float scale)
        Draws a character sequence at a location in 3D space.

        The baseline of the leftmost character is placed at position (x, y, z) in the current coordinate system.

        Parameters:
        text - Text to draw
        x - X coordinate at which to draw
        y - Y coordinate at which to draw
        z - Z coordinate at which to draw
        scale - Uniform scale applied to width and height of text
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if text is null
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current, or is unexpected version

      • draw3D

        public void draw3D(String text,
                   float x,
                   float y,
                   float z,
                   float scale)
        Draws text at a location in 3D space.

        Uses the renderer's current color. The baseline of the leftmost character is placed at position (x, y, z) in the current coordinate system.

        Parameters:
        text - Text to draw
        x - Position to draw on X axis
        y - Position to draw on Y axis
        z - Position to draw on Z axis
        scale - Uniform scale applied to width and height of text
        Throws:
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if no OpenGL context is current, or is unexpected version
        NullPointerException - if text is null

      • end3DRendering

        public void end3DRendering()
        Finishes a 3D render cycle.

      • endRendering

        public void endRendering()
        Finishes a render cycle.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Forces all stored text to be rendered.

        This should be called after each call to draw if you are setting OpenGL state such as the modelview matrix between calls to draw.

        Throws:
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if no OpenGL context is current, or is unexpected version
        IllegalStateException - if not in a render cycle

      • getBounds

        public Rectangle2D getBounds(CharSequence text)
        Determines the bounding box of a character sequence.

        Assumes it was rendered at the origin.

        The coordinate system of the returned rectangle is Java 2D's, with increasing Y coordinates in the downward direction. The relative coordinate (0,0) in the returned rectangle corresponds to the baseline of the leftmost character of the rendered string, in similar fashion to the results returned by, for example, getVisualBounds.

        Most applications will use only the width and height of the returned Rectangle for the purposes of centering or justifying the String. It is not specified which Java 2D bounds (getVisualBounds, getPixelBounds, etc.) the returned bounds correspond to, although every effort is made to ensure an accurate bound.

        Parameters:
        text - Text to get bounding box for
        Returns:
        Rectangle surrounding the given text, not null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if text is null

      • getBounds

        public Rectangle2D getBounds(String text)
        Determines the bounding box of a string.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to get bounding box for
        Returns:
        Rectangle surrounding the given text, not null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if text is null

      • getCharWidth

        public float getCharWidth(char c)
        Determines the pixel width of a character.
        Parameters:
        c - Character to get pixel width of
        Returns:
        Number of pixels required to advance past the character

      • getFont

        public Font getFont()
        Determines the font this TextRenderer is using.
        Returns:
        Font used by this text renderer, not null

      • getSmoothing

        public boolean getSmoothing()
        Checks if the backing texture is using linear interpolation.
        Returns:
        True if the backing texture is using linear interpolation.

      • getUseVertexArrays

        public boolean getUseVertexArrays()
        Checks if vertex arrays are in-use.

        Indicates whether vertex arrays are being used internally for rendering, or whether text is rendered using the OpenGL immediate mode commands. Defaults to true.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(Color color)
        Specifies the current color of this TextRenderer using a Color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color to use for rendering text
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if color is null
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current

      • setColor

        public void setColor(float r,
                     float g,
                     float b,
                     float a)
        Specifies the current color of this TextRenderer using individual components.

        Each component ranges from 0.0f to 1.0f. The alpha component, if used, does not need to be premultiplied into the color channels as described in the documentation for Texture (although premultiplied colors are used internally). The default color is opaque white.

        Parameters:
        r - Red component of the new color
        g - Green component of the new color
        b - Blue component of the new color
        a - Alpha component of the new color

      • setSmoothing

        public void setSmoothing(boolean smoothing)
        Specifies whether the backing texture will use linear interpolation.

        If smoothing is enabled, GL_LINEAR will be used. Otherwise it uses GL_NEAREST.

        Defaults to true.

        A few graphics cards do not behave well when this is enabled, resulting in fuzzy text.

      • setTransform

        public void setTransform(float[] matrix)
        Changes the transformation matrix used for drawing text in 3D.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Transformation matrix in column-major order
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if matrix is null
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if length of matrix is less than sixteen
        IllegalStateException - if in orthographic mode

      • setUseVertexArrays

        public void setUseVertexArrays(boolean useVertexArrays)
        Changes whether vertex arrays are in use.

        This is provided as a concession for certain graphics cards which have poor vertex array performance. If passed true, the text renderer will use vertex arrays or a vertex buffer internally for rendering. Otherwise it will use immediate mode commands. Defaults to true.

        Parameters:
        useVertexArrays - True to render with vertex arrays
